DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft Entire Volume Infusion Procedure Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the entire volume of the hematopoietic cell graft (product) was infused.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft Entire Volume Infusion Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Entire Volume
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:Constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
Constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

Property.preferredDefinition: A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

Concepts.definition: Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
